content:
Hi Alrick

Creation of an email account is done via 3rd party providers such as Microsoft Outlook, Gmail and others.

Are you looking for support to setup Thunderbird's mobile or desktop application with an existing email account you hold?
creator: platform34

content:
The inconsistent behaviour is already fixed by the developers and will be included in the v14 release. A flat view of the Gmail Imap folders was selected, bringing consistency with Thunderbird desktop.

You can find further detail in the links below.

Fix: https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/9742

Initial Change: https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/9134
creator: platform34

content:
Hi Tobias

Undo Deletion

The app gives users the ability to display a confirmation prompt before deletion, rather than an Undo feature. This is enabled from: Settings > General Settings > Interactions: Confirm Actions

Folder add/delete/rename

Adding, deleting and renaming folders is not currently supported within the app. This needs to be managed from your email providers web portal or another client.

The best way to suggest and show support for new ideas is through Mozilla Connect.

A feature request similar to your own is linked below and open to votes. https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/add-the-ability-to-create-imap-folders/idi-p/72777
creator: platform34

content:
Hi Urban

Have you tried refreshing the folder list? Account > manage folders > 3 dot menu > refresh folder list

Your image shows the standard Imap folders are unassigned: "None". Clicking each will normally display a list of folders to select from. Is your list empty?

Can you confirm your connecting via an Imap connection and is the Inbox and Outbox available?
creator: platform34
